rev.comment: /* Traveller's impressions of Nineteenth Century Palestine */
/* Traveller's impressions of Nineteenth Century Palestine */
rv, please correct the grammar and spelling of the content you wish to add.
/* The 20th century */ British occupied not freed Palestine, since Palestine and England were bitter enemies since the first crusade 1099 AD
/* Ottoman rule (1516 - 1917 CE) */ Acre was the Capital of Syria during the Ottoman governer Ahmad Pasha. 1800 to 1840
/* [[Umayyad]] rule (661 - 750 CE) */ Jerusalem capital of Islamic Khilafat in Umayyad times
/* Holy texts */ fixed link to Hethites
Corrected the transcription of the Arabic so that there's a dot under the "t" (for the emphatic consonant)
/* Current status */ Raise map to keep it from protruding into the Demographics section.
/* Byzantine (Eastern Roman Empire) rule (330-640 CE) */ fixed refs
Reverted to revision 132221809 by [[User:Zero0000|Zero0000]]; Actually the source is quite clear. using [[WP:TWINKLE|TW]]
Rv. Please discuss your changes in talk first. to me it looks like the sources was proper and the facts are as the source specify.
/* British Mandate (1920–1948) */ Comment out a statement that the given source does not support. Actually the source claims Jews were treated the same as others in this regard.
/* Current status */ Restored map (under new name) after discussion with DRosenbach, who had removed it. See talk page. ~~~~

sp (6): a agriculturally→an agriculturally, an military→a military, conquerer→conqueror, duing→during, et. al.→et al., supressed→suppressed
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 - 1099 CE) */ correcting page numbers for Shahin refs
/* Boundaries and name */ adding new source
please stop replacing Hebrew translit. with Arabic
/* [[Classical antiquity]] */ again - bringing picture in line with others on the page - the sources for these maps must be noted
trying once again to change the caption on the canaan picture to be in line with the others in the article - is there an autoprotect on the pictures? if so please remove it
/* [[Classical antiquity]] */ placing picture just below for better spacing
restoring correct transliteration of Hebrew - disputable as to whether it came before the arabic or not - no sources attesting to the etymology in that regard either way
/* [[Chalcolithic]] period (4500 - 3000 BCE) and [[Bronze Age]] (3000 - 1200 BCE) */ date and author to be consistent with the rest
restored the names in historical order, it was suddenly changed today.
1) let's use an image without Sinai - less POV; 2) auto-size images; 3) some fmting in tables
/* Hebrew Bible period */ copy edit and wikilink
/* Byzantine (Eastern Roman Empire) rule (330-640 CE) */ wikilinks copy edit etc
/* Roman rule (63 BCE) */ remving information repeated elsewhere, and things unsourced or unfounded based on sources cited, copy edit
/* Hellenistic rule (333 BCE) */ removing unsourced POV and copy editing unsourced section
adding new picture - wish the resolution was better so it could be the lead - if anyone can find a satellite photo without boundaries on it that would be preferable for the first shot
new map for top named Palestine in the Time of Christ - moved other map down - strange how there are so many maps of the 12 tribes of Israel! - need more from other times
movin pictures to their appropriate sections and moving the canaan picture to the top being the most neutral and undisputed designator
/* [[Chalcolithic]] period (4500 - 3000 BCE) and [[Bronze Age]] (3000 - 1200 BCE) */ another missing bracket
/* [[Chalcolithic]] period (4500 - 3000 BCE) and [[Bronze Age]] (3000 - 1200 BCE) */ fixing broken wikilink and removing bracket
/* [[Paleolithic]] and [[Neolithic]] periods (1000000 - 5000 BCE) */ removing broken wikilink
/* Boundaries and name */ adding another source - there are two in the section on the subject below as well - and some copy edits
/* [[Iron Age]] (1200 - 330 BCE) */ fixing wikilinks , mpoving paragraphs down into section on Hebrew Bible period since they are coterminous
/* Current status */ adding Palestinian and and/or since some of these identities are overlapping and not mutually exclusive
/* British Mandate (1920–1948) */ making a sub-heading of 20th century
/* The 19th and 20th centuries */ changing to the 20th century
/* Mamluk rule (1260 - 1516 CE) */ removing unsourced material and updating with sourced info of a similar nature
/* Crusader rule (1099 - 1187 CE) */ more to that sentence
/* Crusader rule (1099 - 1187 CE) */ correcting page number
/* Crusader rule (1099 - 1187 CE) */ brief overview sourced
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 - 1099 CE) */ adding wikilink and English name of agreement
/* Byzantine (Eastern Roman Empire) rule (330-640 CE) */ changing language that could be interpreted as POV
/* Byzantine (Eastern Roman Empire) rule (330-640 CE) */ removing material repeated in section below
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 - 1099 CE) */ removing B
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 - 1099 CE) */ wikilinks and other cleanup
/* Persian rule (538 BCE) */ minor fixes, wikilinks, spacing, flow
/* Boundaries and name */ more grammar flow
/* Boundaries and name */ working on NPOV and simplification - more to come
simplifying introduction - there is no need to repeat the arabic, hebrew and latin names for the other english names used since they are listed at each respective page
/* Byzantine (Eastern Roman Empire) rule (330-640 CE) */ reinserting deleted paragraph
/* Byzantine (Eastern Roman Empire) rule (330-640 CE) */ expanding section adding sources an fact tags and removing paragraph to be inserted in sections below
/* History */ adding info to section on classical antiquity
/* [[Iron Age]] (1200 - 330 BCE) */ copy edit and wikilink
/* [[Iron Age]] (1200 - 330 BCE) */ wikilink to Copenhagen school of theology
/* [[Iron Age]] (1200 - 330 BCE) */ B.C.E. changed to BCE
/* [[Iron Age]] (1200 - 330 BCE) */ expanding iron age section using new sources
/* Boundaries and name */ spacing and some changes in language
/* [[Iron Age]] (1200 - 330 BCE) */ this section needs more work, expansion and better sourcing, I have provided dates and tried to incorporate what was already there - others are welcome to add more
/* Boundaries and name */ changing text per source - the info there previously was not sourced and is incorrect according to the source I have
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 - 1099 CE) */ fix tag
Shahin4, Shahin5, and Shahin6 all reference page 8; inuse done. See talk
Will handle Shahin differently because of various page quotes. this may take a few minutes
/* [[Paleolithic]] and [[Neolithic]] periods (1000000 - 5000 BCE) */ Starting to combine Shahins
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 - 1099 CE) */ adding new material per source
/* History */ moving pictures around to fix gaps in articles
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 - 1099 CE) */ fixing code
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 CE - 1099) */ changing section layout and doing a write up for each dynasty - will fill out Abbasid and Fatimid in the coming hours
/* Classical empires */ change to classical antiquity per article on the subject
/* Hellenistic rule (333 BCE) */ per heading at history of the levant
/* Medieval time */ removing medieval time designator - need more consistent headings based on standrad historical terms
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 CE) */ corecting wikilink
/* Arab Caliphate rule (638 CE) */ some copy edits - this section need sto sourced and expanded as with the Hebrew bible section above
/* [[Iron Age]] (1200 - 330 BCE) */ moving sentence from section above into new section on persian rule per source
/* History */ adding dates to all periods and new section
fix code cite book not cite web
/* History */ remove commas from years to respect year formatting already used
/* History */ moving article links to appropriate section below
/* [[Chalcolithic]] period (4,500 - 3,000 BCE) and [[Bronze Age]] (3,000 - 1,200 BCE) */ more
/* [[Chalcolithic]] period (4,500 - 3,000 BCE) and [[Bronze Age]] (3,000 - 1,200 BCE) */ wikilinks
/* History */ beginning to expand history section which is not covered in the articles cited
clean up, Typos fixed: reknown → renown,, Replaced: Sanremo conference → San Remo conference using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Current demographics */ Palestine no longer exists. It is no longer a recognized entity.
/* Current status */ As stated in the paragraph, "Palestine" is a political term. It does not exist as a state, and this map, reflecting political propoganda, is both misleading and incorrect.
/* Current status */ There is no nation known as "Palestine." It does not exist.
/* Demographics in the late Ottoman and British Mandate periods */
/* Current status */ added footnote, moved map up
/* Demographics in the late Ottoman and British Mandate periods */ transform another html table into a wikitable
/* Bible period */ 2 dates back to BCE notation
/* Demographics */ 1) wikitable takes care of all that formatting, no need for excessive html. 2) Christian Era >> Common Era
/* Current status */ an attempt at NPOV.
unbold names not used in English, per usual style and to make the intro more readable
The undisputed facts in my three added paragraphs and the new map are essential to an understanding of the current status of Palestine.
Pelesheth is the Hebrew name for Philistia, not Palestine
/* Boundaries and name */ Fixed link to 830s BC
robot Adding: [[th:ปาเลสไตน์]]
reverting to an image that is about to be deleted is pointless - please address issues with the image to the relevant talk page
the problem was with use of the modified image
rv unilateral POV [[WP:AES|←]]Undid revision 118361705 by [[Special:Contributions/ChrisO|ChrisO]] ([[User talk:ChrisO|talk]])
Replaced image with recomposited version of same
/* Genetic analyses of regional populations */ Repairing link to disambiguation page - [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]]
/* Current demographics */ fixing a typo...adding citation needed tag.
/* British Mandate (1920–1948) */ External Links used as sources either need to be cited as REFS properly or put in an EL section. I opted for the REF tag for now.
/* Holy texts */ another missing space fixed c/e
/* Boundaries and name */ just inserting a space c/e
/* UN partition */ one on top is better, so image goes in "current" section, and previous description was more accurate - let's not be too obvious in our POV, ok?
/* UN partition */ - add new map; maps in table
Clear up the distracting level of blank space in the lead of this longer article by adding {{[[Template:TOChidden|TOChidden]]}} which makes the TOC -Table of contents- default collapsed

fix map translation after asking some wikipedian who actually know Latin

/* Genetic analyses of regional populations */ # Repairing link to disambiguation page - [[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]]
